availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Prewitt Newman in Shelby County in July 1818. Father of John E. Newman, William H. Newman, Martha A. Newman, and Josephine Newman. Resident of Shelby County in 1820. Owned one enslaved person in Shelby County in 1820. Farmer in Spencer County in 1840. Owned eight enslaved persons in Spencer County in 1840. Farmer in Spencer County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Spencer County in 1850. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson, District 1, p. 109B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259282, p. 106.
Find A Grave, "Thomas Newman (1793-1863)," Memorial 100878533, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100878533 (accessed April 14, 2020).
